dialogs.text: NewImage00 What are you trying to do here?

choices.text: I just want to get to know my roommate. She's never talked to me before.

dialogs.text: Oh, that sounds tricky. You'll both have to communicate in a way that you can understand each other.

choices.text: You're the expert on human interaction. I'm calling in my favor for getting you that mushroom. Can you help me?

dialogs.text: Of course! I'm still working on eating that delectable fungi, but I'll assist you in any way I can.
RevealResults13 They can't talk in words, but they still talk in social cues! Try paying attention to body language and you might be able to understand.

choices.text: Are you happy I'm talking with you?
Do you have a crush on me?

dialogs.text: NewImage00 That looks like a yes! It's great that they want to chat with you, but they're still too shy to talk.
RevealResults09 By paying attention to your own social cues as well, you can send certain messages. That might help!

choices.text: *Smile and leave your arms at your side*
*Rest your hands on your hips and make eye contact*

dialogs.text: RevealResults05 Visual social cues seem more powerful than audible ones. Yet many people barely even notice them. Humans really are funny creatures!
NewImage00 Putting your hands on your hips signifies aggression and dominance. I don't think your roommate appreciates it very much.
RevealResults05 Good thing you used visual social cues, 'cause they seem more powerful than audible ones. Yet many people barely even notice them. Humans really are funny creatures!

choices.text: Wanna hear a joke? 'What's red and smells like blue paint?' 'Red paint.'
Wanna hear a joke? 'I could totally see myself working at a mirror factory.'

dialogs.text: RevealResults20 The ridiculous jokes are just slightly more popular than the thoughtful ones. But I think jokes are always fun.

choices.text: Are you going to say something???
